_program_info.program_name: Master of Engineering (MEng) in Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
_program_info.program_length: Full-time: 4 terms (16 months), Part-time: 8 terms (32 months)
_program_info.funding_note: The University of Waterloo does not provide funding for MEng in Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering students, and the candidates are expected to be self-supporting.

level_constraints.description: A maximum of 2 500-level courses may be counted for credit

departmental_constraints.description: At least 4 out of the 8 required courses must be ME courses, and at least 2 of the 8 must be ME 600-level courses

faculty_constraints.description: At least half of the courses used for credit must normally be Faculty of Engineering courses and the other half need to be Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering courses

grade_requirements.description: The candidate must obtain a pass in all courses credited to their program, with a minimum overall average of 70% (a grade of less than 65% in any course counts as a failure)

emls_requirement.description: An English for Multilingual Speakers (EMLS) technical/professional course is normally required for all students who were not English Language Proficiency (ELP) exempt at the time of admission
emls_requirement.waiver: The EMLS communication course can be waived at the discretion of the Department

seminar_attendance.description: Students must attend at least 4 Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering research seminars

specified_fixed: ME 600 - Engineering Practice, Research Methods, Ethics & Professional Development for MME Graduate Students (0.25 unit weight)

list: 8 graduate level courses (0.50 unit weight each)
elective.note: Of the 8 courses, at least 4 must be Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering courses, and at least 2 of the 8 must be ME 600-level courses. A maximum of 2 500-level courses may be counted for credit. An English for Multilingual Speakers (EMLS) course is normally required for all students who were not ELP exempt at the time of admission.

Mechanical_Mechatronics_MEng.description: Core MEng program requiring ME 600 plus 8 graduate level courses with departmental and level constraints.

Building_Systems.note: No more than 1 of the 4 courses may be 500-level.

options: CIVE 507 - Building Science and Technology or CIVE 707 - Advanced Building Science
ME 567 - Fire Safety Engineering
ME 654 - Advanced Applied Thermal Engineering
ME 655 - Advanced Building Energy Analysis
ME 656 - Advanced HVAC Systems, Equipment, and Energy Efficiency

list: CIVE 507 - Building Science and Technology or CIVE 707 - Advanced Building Science
ME 656 - Advanced HVAC Systems, Equipment, and Energy Efficiency
ME 566 - Computational Fluid Dynamics for Engineering Design

Building_Systems.description: Graduate Specialization in Building Systems. Choose 4 total between Set-A and Set-B. A minimum of 2 must be taken from Set-A.

options: ME 531 - Physical Metallurgy Applied to Manufacturing
ME 559 - Finite Element Methods or ME 621 - Advanced Finite Element Method
ME 620 - Mechanics of Continua
ME 631 - Mechanical Metallurgy
ME 632 - Experimental Methods in Materials Engineering
ME 739 Manufacturing Processes Topics: Topic 15 - Additive Manufacturing Design

list: ME 538 - Welding Design, Fabrication and Quality Control
ME 596 Special Topics in Mechanical Engineering: Topic 12 - Manufacturing of Mechatronics Materials and Components
ME 735 Special Topics - Welding and Joining: Topic 2 - Advanced Materials Joining
ME 739 Manufacturing Processes Topics: Topic 15 - Additive Manufacturing
NANO 605 - Design of MEMS and NEMS
NANO 606 - Advanced Microelectromechanical Systems: Physics, Design & Fabrication

Materials_Advanced_Manufacturing.description: Graduate Specialization with 2 courses from Set-A and 2 from Set-B. No more than 1 of the 4 courses may be 500-level.

options: ECE 602 - Introduction to Optimization
ECE 650 - Methods and Tools for Software Engineering
ME 547 - Robotic Manipulators: Kinematics, Dynamics and Control
ME 640 - Autonomous Mobile Robotics
ME 649 - Control of Machines and Processes
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 1 - Precision Control Systems
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 5 - Computational Intelligence

list: ECE 780 Special Topics in Control: Topic 11 - Model Predictive Control
ME 540 - Fundamentals in Neural and Rehabilitation Engineering
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 17 - Vehicle System Dynamics
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 14 - Electromagnetic Actuators
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 10 - Adaptive Control
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 37 - Human Movement Neuromechanics
ME 780 Special Topics in Mechatronics: Topic 38 - Design of a Mechatronic System

Mechatronic_Systems.description: Graduate Specialization with 2 courses from Set-A and 2 from Set-B. No more than 1 of the 4 courses may be 500-level.

options: ME 654 - Advanced Applied Thermal Engineering
ME 659 - Energy and Environment

list: ME 760 Special Topics in Thermal Engineering: Energy Storage
ME 765 Special Topics in Fluid Mechanics: Topic 6 - Wind Energy
ME 566 - Computational Fluid Dynamics for Engineering Design

Sustainable_Energy.description: Graduate Specialization with minimum 1 from Set-A, at least 3 total from Set-A and Set-B. No more than 1 of the 4 courses may be 500-level.

_specialization_info.selection_note: Students may choose to pursue one of the Graduate Specializations as part of their MEng program
_specialization_info.course_structure: All MEng Graduate Specializations consist of at least 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses comprised of a mix of compulsory and elective courses
_specialization_info.level_constraint: No more than 1 of the 4 specialization courses may be 500-level for most specializations
